Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Plucky \Pluck"y\, a. [Compar. {Pluckier}; superl. {Pluckiest}.] Having pluck or courage; characterized by pluck; displaying pluck; courageous; spirited; as, a plucky race. [1913 Webster]
If you're plucky, and not over subject to fright. --Barham. [1913 Webster]

plucky adj 1: showing courage; "the champion is faced with a feisty challenger" [syn: {feisty}, {spunky}] 2: showing courage in the face of danger; "a plucky lampooner of the administration" [also: {pluckiest}, {pluckier}]
